titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Howard Roberts Lamar Papers
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:37

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Howard Roberts Lamar papers document the research, writing, teaching, and administrative activities of Yale history professor Howard Lamar from the 1940s through 2000. Included in the papers are manuscript drafts of books, articles, speeches, and book reviews; lecture notes for the history courses he taught at Yale and other universities; topical and personal files; and correspondence. Project proposals, scripts, research material, production files, photographs, and films document the "Westering" film project which Lamar co-developed in the 1970s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Yale University Press, 1957, and Howard Lamar Roberts, 1994, 2002, and 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Cold Storage 31-98 (film reels): Restricted fragile material. Consult the Beinecke Library Access Services department for additional information.
Boxes 20-21 and 109-119: Restricted until 2035. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Box 22: Restricted until 2064. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Box 120: Restricted until 2020. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Boxes 121-122: Restricted until 2075. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
Access to original audio visual recordings is restricted pending reformatting. Consult the Beinecke Library Access Services department for additional information.
Box 123 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Copies of electronic files disks #4-21 from Box 99 are available through Access Services.
Box 124 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Howard Roberts Lamar Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Howard Roberts Lamar Papers. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received preliminary processing at the time of acquisition in 1957, 1994, and 2002. Further organization, rehousing and/or description was carried out in 2010. The collection is comprised of material formerly classed as Uncat WA MS Lamar, Uncat WA MS 177, and Uncat MSS 403. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, according to month and year of acquisition.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Howard Roberts Lamar, 1923-
bioghist.p: Howard Roberts Lamar, historian of the trans-Mississippi West, was born in Tuskegee, Alabama in 1923. He received a B.A. from Emory University in 1944, and a Masters (1945) and Ph.d. (1951) in History from Yale University. He was an instructor at the University of Massachusetts and Wesleyan University between 1945 and 1949, and taught at Yale from 1949 to 1994. He held a number of administrative positions at Yale including chair of the Department of History 1962-1963 and 1967-1970, Dean of the College 1979-1985, and President of the University 1992-1993. He is Sterling Professor Emeritus of American History at Yale.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Howard Roberts Lamar papers document the research, writing, teaching, and administrative activities of Yale history professor Howard Lamar from the 1940s through 2000. Included in the papers are manuscript drafts of books, articles, speeches, and book reviews; lecture notes for history courses he taught at Yale and other universities; topical and personal files; and correspondence. Project proposals, scripts, research material, production files, photographs, and films document the "Westering" film project which Lamar co-developed in the 1970s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four groupings: I. February 1957 Acquisition, 1956. II. June 1994 Acquisition, 1942-1993. III. July 2002 Acquisition, 1969-1979. IV. August 2010 Acquisition, 1942-2000.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five series: Writings, Lecture Notes, Topical Files, Personal Files, and Publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of various typescripts of books, articles and papers, speeches, book reviews; files relating to professional projects; class and lecture notes from courses both studied and taught by Lamar; correspondence, and miscellaneous publications.

scopecontent.p: Includes manuscripts of books, articles and papers, speeches, and book reviews by Howard Lamar.
